00018 //=========================================================================================
00019 //
00020 // Generate DataSet.h, a file declaring and defining DataSet template class,
00021 // a class that represents an entire population data set.
00022 //
00023 // Pre-conditions  - The symbol table contains the NONMEM keywords and user defined variable
00024 //                   names needed by the user-provided model.
00025 //
00026 //                 - The symbol table contains entries for the data labels and aliases.
00027 //                   The list of data labels have to be retrievable by calling 
00028 //                   SymbolTable::getlabels().  
00029 //          
00030 //                 - The vector returned by SymbolTable::getLables() must contain
00031 //                   the data labels in the order in which they define the data items 
00032 //                   (ie. columns) in the data set.
00033 //
00034 //                 - The current working directory is writable.
00035 //
00036 // post-conditions - DataSet.h will be generated in the current working directory.
00037 //
00038 //=========================================================================================
00039 void NonmemTranslator::generateDataSet( ) const
00040 {
00041   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00042   //
00043   // Preliminaries
00044   //
00045   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00046 
00047   // 
00048   // A SymbolTable object uses a std::map object as the actual
00049   // table.  The usual way of retrieving the entries in the internal
00050   // table is though member functions provided by SymbolTable class.
00051   // Another way, which is used here, is to access the internal
00052   // table directly, which is faster and convenient.
00053   //
00054   const map<const string, Symbol> * const t = table->getTable();
00055 
00056   //
00057   // The order in which the label strings appear is significant.
00058   // So, get a constant pointer to the list so that I cannot 
00059   // mess it up.
00060   //
00061   const vector<string> *labels = table->getLabels();
00062   vector<string>::const_iterator pLabel;
00063   const int nLabels = labels->size();
00064 
00065   //
00066   // Reference to an Symbol object that represents "ID" data label.
00067   // Keep it for repetitive use.
00068   //
00069   const Symbol * const pID = table->find( nonmem::ID );
00070 
00071   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00072   //
00073   // Write into DataSet.h
00074   //
00075   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
00076 
00077   //
00078   // Declare and define DataSet template class.
00079   // For name binding reason, the declaration and the definition
00080   // are both stored in a single file: DataSet.h
00081   // 
00082   // The only legal constructor is the default constructor.
00083   // The constructor initializes the array of IndData objects,
00084   // each contains the entire data set for a subject.
00085   //
00086   // The order in which the arguments to the IndData 
00087   // constructor appear is significant.  The order must
00088   // match with the IndData constructor's interface.
00089   // It relizes on the order of strings stored in the list 
00090   // returned by "SymbolTable::getLabels()".
00091   // Thus, in between the time when the DataSet constructor
00092   // is defined and the time when the IndData constructor
00093   // is declared/defined, the SymbolTable object
00094   // may NOT be modified.
00095   //
00096   ofstream oDataSet_h( fDataSet_h );
00097   if( !oDataSet_h.good() )
00098     {
00099       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
00100       snprintf( mess, 
00101         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
00102         "Failed to create a file, %s.", fDataSet_h );
00103       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_STD_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
00104       throw e;
00105     }
00106 
00107   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00108   //
00109   // Print out some description for this file.
00110   //
00111   //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00112   oDataSet_h << "// " << myDescription << endl;
00113

00487   // ==============================NO CHANGE BELOW ==============================================
00488   // 
00489   // Extracts measurements (ie. SPK's y) from the entire data set and keep it in "measurements".
00490   //
00491   oDataSet_h << "   int nRecords = 0;" << endl;
00492   oDataSet_h << "   for( int i=0; i<popSize; i++ )" << endl;
00493   oDataSet_h << "      nRecords += data[i]->getNRecords();" << endl;
00494   oDataSet_h << "   " << endl;
00495   oDataSet_h << "   int nY = 0;  // # of DVs" << endl;
00496   oDataSet_h << "   for( int i=0; i<popSize; i++ )" << endl;
00497   oDataSet_h << "   {" << endl;
00498   oDataSet_h << "      NObservs[i] = data[i]->getMeasurements().size();" << endl;
00499   oDataSet_h << "      nY += NObservs[i];" << endl;  
00500   oDataSet_h << "   }" << endl;
00501   oDataSet_h << "   measurements.resize( nY ); " << endl;
00502   oDataSet_h << "   jPrimeToj.resize( nY );" << endl;
00503   oDataSet_h << "   jTojPrime.resize( nRecords );" << endl;
00504   oDataSet_h << "   for( int i=0, m=0, j=0, jPrime=0; i<popSize; i++ )" << endl;
00505   oDataSet_h << "   {" << endl;
00506   oDataSet_h << "      int nYi = data[i]->getMeasurements().size();" << endl;
00507   oDataSet_h << "      measurements[ SPK_VA::slice( m, nYi, 1 ) ] = data[i]->getMeasurements();" << endl;
00508   oDataSet_h << "      m+=nYi;" << endl;
00509   oDataSet_h << "      int n = data[i]->getNRecords();" << endl;
00510   oDataSet_h << "      for( int k=0; k<n; k++, j++ )" << endl;
00511   oDataSet_h << "      {" << endl;
00512   oDataSet_h << "         if( data[i]->" << nonmem::MDV << "[k] == 0 )" << endl;
00513   oDataSet_h << "         {" << endl;
00514   oDataSet_h << "            jPrimeToj[jPrime] = j;" << endl;
00515   oDataSet_h << "            jTojPrime[j] = jPrime;" << endl;
00516   oDataSet_h << "            jPrime++;" << endl;
00517   oDataSet_h << "         }" << endl;
00518   oDataSet_h << "         else" << endl;
00519   oDataSet_h << "            jTojPrime[j] = -1;" << endl;
00520   oDataSet_h << "      }" << endl;
00521   oDataSet_h << "   }" << endl;
00522 
00523   oDataSet_h << "}" << endl;
00524   oDataSet_h << endl;

00909   oDataSet_h << "void DataSet<spk_ValueType>::replaceCWRes( const SPK_VA::valarray<double>& cWResIn )"    << endl;
00910   oDataSet_h << "{" << endl;
00911   oDataSet_h << "   const int n = data.size();" << endl;
00912   oDataSet_h << "   for( int i=0, k=0; i<n; k+=NRecords[i++] )" << endl;
00913   oDataSet_h << "   {" << endl;
00914   oDataSet_h << "      data[i]->replaceCWRes( cWResIn[ SPK_VA::slice(k, NRecords[i], 1) ] );" << endl;
00915   oDataSet_h << "   }" << endl;
00916   oDataSet_h << "}" << endl;
00917   oDataSet_h << endl;
00918 
00919   if( getTarget() == POP )
00920     {

01065 
01066   // ---------
01067   // Extractor
01068   // ---------
01069   oDataSet_h << "// Extracts the contents of this class object in the SpkResultML::presentation_data form." << endl;
01070   oDataSet_h << "template <class spk_ValueType>" << endl;
01071   oDataSet_h << "std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& o, const DataSet<spk_ValueType>& A )" << endl;
01072   oDataSet_h << "{" << endl;
01073   oDataSet_h << "   using std::endl;" << endl;
01074 
01075   // Compute the number of items that are supposed to be printed out in <presentation_data>.
01076   // This includes User defined scalar variables, NONMEM (scalar/vector/matrix)
01077   // and RES/WRES.
01078   // 
01079   // THETA/ETA/OMEGA/(EPS)/(SIGMA) are vectors or matrices.
01080   // <presentation_data> prints out elements of these objects one by one.
01081   // That is, if THETA had a length of 2, it prints out THETA(1) and THETA(2) individually.
01082   // The names such as "THETA" is already in the symbol table, so when we get the size of
01083   // SymbolTable object, it returns the number that already contains the count for "THETA".
01084   // So, we increment the country by (2-1)=1. 
01085   const int nItems = t->size();
01086   int nColumns = nItems
01087     + myThetaLen-1
01088     + myEtaLen-1 
01089     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEpsLen - 1) : 0 ) // for EPS
01090     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for ETARES
01091     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for WETARES
01092     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for IETARES
01093     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for IWETARES
01094     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for PETARES
01095     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for PWETARES
01096     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for CETARES
01097     + (getTarget()==POP? (myEtaLen - 1) : 0 ) // for CWETARES
01098     - (table->find(nonmem::OMEGA)   == Symbol::empty()? 0 : 1 )
01099     - (table->find(nonmem::SIGMA)   == Symbol::empty()? 0 : 1 );
01100  
01101   if( myCompModel )
01102     {
01103       const Symbol* s;
01104       if( ( s = table->find( nonmem::DADT ) ) != Symbol::empty() )
01105     {
01106       if( s->object_type == Symbol::VECTOR )
01107         nColumns += myCompModel->getNCompartments()-1;
01108     }
01109       if( ( s = table->find( nonmem::A ) ) != Symbol::empty() )
01110     {
01111       if( s->object_type == Symbol::VECTOR )
01112         nColumns += myCompModel->getNCompartments()-1;
01113     }
01114       if( ( s = table->find( nonmem::P ) ) != Symbol::empty() )
01115     {
01116       if( s->object_type == Symbol::VECTOR )
01117         nColumns += myCompModel->getNParameters()-1;
01118     }
01119       if( ( s = table->find( nonmem::T ) ) != Symbol::empty() )
01120     {
01121       nColumns--;
01122     }
01123     }
01124 
01125   map<const string, Symbol>::const_iterator pEntry = t->begin();
01126   const vector<string>::const_iterator pLabelBegin = table->getLabels()->begin();
01127   const vector<string>::const_iterator pLabelEnd   = table->getLabels()->end();
01128   vector<string> whatGoesIn;  // will hold those labels in the order that actually go into the data section.
01129   vector<string>::const_iterator pWhatGoesIn;
01130 
01131   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
01132   // Open <presentation_data>
01133   //
01134   oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<\" << \"presentation_data\" << \" rows=\\\"\" << A.NRecords.sum() << \"\\\" \";" << endl;
01135   oDataSet_h << "   o << \"columns=\\\"" << nColumns << "\\\">\" << endl;" << endl;
01136 
01137   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01138   // Begin printing out labels.
01139   //
01140 //  oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<data_labels>\" << endl;" << endl;
01141   
01142   // Put ID first in the sequence
01143   whatGoesIn.push_back( pID->name );
01144 //  oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"" << pID->name << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;
01145   oDataSet_h << "   o << \"ID";
01146   
01147   // ...aaand, following ID is, all the left hand side quantities in the model definition.
01148   // cntColumns is initialized to 1 because the ID column is already printed out.
01149   int cntColumns = 1;
01150   for( cntColumns=1,  pEntry = t->begin(); pEntry!=t->end(); pEntry++ )
01151     {
01152       if( pEntry->first != nonmem::ID )
01153     {
01154       // Skip Omega and Sigma.
01155           // These values are not computed by Pred::eval().
01156       if(    pEntry->first != nonmem::OMEGA 
01157          && pEntry->first != nonmem::SIGMA )
01158         {
01159           whatGoesIn.push_back( pEntry->second.name );
01160           
01161           // theta: This is a vector.  So, all element values have to be printed out individually.
01162           if( pEntry->first == nonmem::THETA )
01163         {
01164           for( int cntTheta=0; cntTheta<myThetaLen; cntTheta++ )
01165             {
01166                       oDataSet_h << ",";
01167 //            oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"";
01168               oDataSet_h << pEntry->second.name << "(" << cntTheta+1 << ")";
01169 //            oDataSet_h << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;
01170               cntColumns++;
01171             }
01172         }
01173           // eta, etares, wetares: These are vectors of length myEtaLen.
01174               // So, all elements values have to be printed out individually.
01175           else if( pEntry->first == nonmem::ETA
01176                || pEntry->first == nonmem::ETARES 
01177                || pEntry->first == nonmem::WETARES
01178                || pEntry->first == nonmem::IETARES 
01179                || pEntry->first == nonmem::IWETARES
01180                || pEntry->first == nonmem::PETARES 
01181                || pEntry->first == nonmem::PWETARES
01182                || pEntry->first == nonmem::CETARES 
01183                || pEntry->first == nonmem::CWETARES )
01184         {
01185           for( int cntEta=0; cntEta<myEtaLen; cntEta++ )
01186             {
01187                       oDataSet_h << ",";
01188 //            oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"";
01189               oDataSet_h << pEntry->second.name << "(" << cntEta+1 << ")";
01190 //            oDataSet_h << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;              
01191               cntColumns++;
01192             }
01193         }
01194           // eps: This is a vector of length myEpsLen.
01195               // So, all elements values have to be printed out individually.
01196           else if( pEntry->first == nonmem::EPS )
01197         {
01198           for( int cntEps=0; cntEps<myEpsLen; cntEps++ )
01199             {
01200                       oDataSet_h << ",";
01201 //            oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"";
01202               oDataSet_h << pEntry->second.name << "(" << cntEps+1 << ")";
01203 //            oDataSet_h << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;
01204               cntColumns++;
01205             }
01206         }
01207           // DADT or A: This is a vector of length nCompartments
01208           else if( (pEntry->first == nonmem::DADT || pEntry->first == nonmem::A )
01209                && myCompModel ) 
01210         {
01211           for( int cnt=0; cnt<myCompModel->getNCompartments(); cnt++ )
01212             {
01213                       oDataSet_h << ",";
01214 //            oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"";
01215               oDataSet_h << pEntry->second.name << "(" << cnt+1 << ")";
01216 //            oDataSet_h << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;              
01217               cntColumns++;
01218             }
01219         }
01220           // P: This is a vector of length nParameters
01221           else if( pEntry->first == nonmem::P && myCompModel )
01222         {
01223           for( int cnt=0; cnt<myCompModel->getNParameters(); cnt++ )
01224             {
01225                       oDataSet_h << ",";
01226 //            oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"";
01227               oDataSet_h << pEntry->second.name << "(" << cnt+1 << ")";
01228 //            oDataSet_h << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;              
01229               cntColumns++;
01230             }
01231         }
01232 
01233           // T should be omitted from print out if it means the ODE's T.
01234           else if( myCompModel && (pEntry->first == nonmem::T) ) 
01235         {
01236           // ignore
01237         }
01238 
01239           // scalar variables (user-defined variables & NONMEM reserved variables).
01240           else
01241         {
01242                   oDataSet_h << ",";
01243 //        oDataSet_h << "   o << \"<label name=\\\"";
01244           oDataSet_h << pEntry->second.name;
01245 //        oDataSet_h << "\\\"/>\" << endl;" << endl;
01246           cntColumns++;
01247         }
01248         }
01249     }
01250     }
01251 
01252   // Sanity check; is the actual number of labels (ie. columns) match the value given by the user earlier?
01253 
01254   if( cntColumns != nColumns )
01255     {
01256       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
01257       snprintf( mess, 
01258         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
01259         "The number of data items (%d) does not match the number of labels (%d).",
01260         cntColumns, nColumns );
01261       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_USER_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
01262       throw e;
01263     }
01264 
01265 //  oDataSet_h << "   o << \"</data_labels>\" << endl;" << endl;
01266   oDataSet_h << "\" << endl;" << endl;
01267   //
01268   // End of labels.
01269   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01270   
01271   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01272   // Begin printing out computed values.
01273   // 
01274   oDataSet_h << "   for( int i=0, position=1; i<A.getPopSize(); i++ )" << endl;
01275   oDataSet_h << "   {" << endl;
01276   oDataSet_h << "      for( int j=0; j<A.NRecords[i]; j++, position++ )" << endl;
01277   oDataSet_h << "      {" << endl;
01278 //  oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<row position=\\\"\" << position << \"\\\">\" << endl;" << endl;
01279 
01280   for( cntColumns=0, pWhatGoesIn = whatGoesIn.begin(); pWhatGoesIn!=whatGoesIn.end(); pWhatGoesIn++ )
01281     {
01282       if( *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::THETA )
01283     {
01284       for( int cntTheta=0; cntTheta<myThetaLen; cntTheta++ )
01285         {
01286               oDataSet_h << " << \",\" << ";
01287 //        oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<value ref=\\\"";
01288 //        oDataSet_h << *pWhatGoesIn << "(" << cntTheta+1 << ")" << "\\\"" << ">\" << ";
01289           oDataSet_h << "A.data[i]->" << *pWhatGoesIn << "[j][" << cntTheta << "]";
01290 //        oDataSet_h << " << \"</value>\" << endl;" << endl;
01291           cntColumns++;
01292         }
01293     }
01294       else if( *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::ETA
01295            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::ETARES
01296            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::WETARES
01297            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::IETARES
01298            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::IWETARES
01299            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::PETARES
01300            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::PWETARES
01301            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::CETARES
01302            || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::CWETARES )
01303     {
01304       for( int cntEta=0; cntEta<myEtaLen; cntEta++ )
01305         {
01306               oDataSet_h << " << \",\" << ";
01307 //        oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<value ref=\\\"";
01308 //        oDataSet_h << *pWhatGoesIn << "(" << cntEta+1 << ")"<< "\\\"" << ">\" << ";
01309           oDataSet_h << "A.data[i]->" << *pWhatGoesIn << "[j][" << cntEta << "]";
01310 //        oDataSet_h << " << \"</value>\" << endl;" << endl;
01311           cntColumns++;
01312         }
01313     }
01314       else if( *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::EPS && getTarget() == POP )
01315     {
01316       for( int cntEps=0; cntEps<myEpsLen; cntEps++ )
01317         {
01318               oDataSet_h << " << \",\" << ";
01319 //        oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<value ref=\\\"";
01320 //        oDataSet_h << *pWhatGoesIn << "(" << cntEps+1 << ")"<< "\\\"" << ">\" << ";
01321           oDataSet_h << "A.data[i]->" << *pWhatGoesIn << "[j][" << cntEps << "]";
01322 //        oDataSet_h << " << \"</value>\" << endl;" << endl;
01323           cntColumns++;
01324         }
01325     }
01326       else if( *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::OMEGA || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::SIGMA )
01327     {
01328       // ignore
01329     }
01330       else if( ( *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::DADT || *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::A ) 
01331            && myCompModel )
01332     {
01333       for( int cnt=0; cnt<myCompModel->getNCompartments(); cnt++ )
01334         {
01335               oDataSet_h << " << \",\" << ";
01336 //        oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<value ref=\\\"";
01337 //        oDataSet_h << *pWhatGoesIn << "(" << cnt+1 << ")"<< "\\\"" << ">\" << ";
01338           oDataSet_h << "A.data[i]->" << *pWhatGoesIn << "[j][" << cnt << "]";
01339 //        oDataSet_h << " << \"</value>\" << endl;" << endl;
01340           cntColumns++;
01341         }
01342     }
01343       else if( *pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::P && myCompModel )
01344     {
01345       for( int cnt=0; cnt<myCompModel->getNParameters(); cnt++ )
01346         {
01347               oDataSet_h << " << \",\" << ";
01348 //        oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<value ref=\\\"";
01349 //        oDataSet_h << *pWhatGoesIn << "(" << cnt+1 << ")"<< "\\\"" << ">\" << ";
01350           oDataSet_h << "A.data[i]->" << *pWhatGoesIn << "[j][" << cnt << "]";
01351 //        oDataSet_h << " << \"</value>\" << endl;" << endl;
01352           cntColumns++;
01353         }
01354     }
01355       else if( myCompModel && (*pWhatGoesIn == nonmem::T) )
01356         {
01357           // ignore
01358         }
01359       else 
01360     {
01361           string s(*pWhatGoesIn);
01362           if(s.compare(0, 2, "ID") == 0) oDataSet_h << "         o << ";
01363           else oDataSet_h << " << \",\" << ";
01364 //    oDataSet_h << "         o << \"<value ref=\\\"" << *pWhatGoesIn << "\\\"" << ">\" << ";
01365       oDataSet_h << "A.data[i]->" << *pWhatGoesIn << "[j]";
01366 //    oDataSet_h << " << \"</value>\" << endl;" << endl;
01367       cntColumns++;
01368     }
01369     }
01370   if( cntColumns != nColumns )
01371     {
01372       char mess[ SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen() ];
01373       snprintf( mess, 
01374         SpkCompilerError::maxMessageLen(),
01375         "The number of data items (%d), does not the number of labels (%d).",
01376         cntColumns, nColumns );
01377       SpkCompilerException e( SpkCompilerError::ASPK_USER_ERR, mess, __LINE__, __FILE__ );
01378       throw e;
01379     }
01380 //  oDataSet_h << "         o << \"</row>\" << endl;" << endl;
01381   oDataSet_h << " << endl;" << endl;
01382   oDataSet_h << "      }" << endl;
01383   oDataSet_h << "   }" << endl;
01384   //
01385   // End of computed values.
01386   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01387   
01388   oDataSet_h << "   o << \"</\" << \"presentation_data\" << \">\";" << endl;
01389   //
01390   // Close <presentation_data>
01391   //+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
01392   oDataSet_h << "};" << endl;
01393 
01394 
01395   oDataSet_h << "template <class spk_ValueType>" << endl;
01396   oDataSet_h << "std::ostream& operator<< ( std::ostream& o, const DataSet<spk_ValueType>& A );" << endl;
01397   oDataSet_h << "#endif" << endl;
01398   oDataSet_h.close();
01399 }
